page.title: 18WAYTES COURT FARM,BRIGHSTONE
page.content: This farm has 400 acres of which 180 acres were ploughed this season. The rest of the land is used for grazing beef cattle.The crops grown arewheat, barley and winter oats. He also grows some potatoes.His crops are all sold, not fed to the animals. The barley goes to make beer!He does make silage for his animals however.This is processed grass which is put into a clamp at the farm and fermented. As well as the cows the farmer keeps a few sheep and a sheep_dog. However the beef cattle are the main concern. They are bought as calves not bred at the farm. Then they are fed on protein barley which the farmer has to buy in. He then sells the cattle for meat. The farmer's wife keps house and is always around to answer the telephone.
